title: The Problem with Toxicity Based Bans
body:
There is a huge disconnect between what is bannable and what is standard for a game, atleast in OCE.

I recently got banned and even I think that was a weak game to ban me over, the flaming in it was minimal to what I have done in the past and not even close to what has been done to me and I still wouldnt consider either bannable. Especially because flaming is so prevalent, people often flame in response to flame which is also bannable which is even more odd

replies.body: So what did your chat logs say? I think it's one thing if you don't feel like you should be banned, but if community members feel otherwise, then I'd say it's justified.

> [{quoted}](name=Periscope,realm=NA,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=eQUquAc2,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-03-22T04:06:59.586+0000)
>
> So what did your chat logs say? I think it's one thing if you don't feel like you should be banned, but if community members feel otherwise, then I'd say it's justified.

I'm not asking to be unbanned, i'm just pointing out that this toxicity is prevalent in all areas of the game. The people in that game were flaming as well, I was flaming, people I Q with flame and I even admit I have been more toxic than the chat logs chose to ban me.

This game slowly wears down players because the whole community is toxic

riot9automated system) have a snowflake approach to players behavior "if someone is offended they deserve to be banned" and that's as simple as it goes  that in itself is the wrong way to do things and there is nothing we can do about it

There's a reason system of law are not actively democratic, vocal minorities would have you hung for things like pre-marrital sex, because more relaxed and laid back opinions, though maybe the majority, don't actively report and protest against those vocal minorities.
ie. Generally snowflakes report a lot more than your average gamer.

The biggest thing lacking is actual troll bans. So many trolls and inters go unpunished. 
There is a clear distinction between someone who plays badly or gives up, or etc.. and someone who intentionally trolls/ints. And the latter should be severely punished, but they really aren't as there's no way to automatically detect this.
I think there's possibly some misconception within the community/devs that a lot of trolling/inting happens as a result of toxicity, when from my experience, it can be sparked by the person simply playing badly for the first few minutes, or even the slightest angst from another player;
 "dude why did you come to lane at low health!? it was obvious you'd die if you did that"
"I was just trying to help (internally; fuck this guy, i'm inting now)"
And there's absolutely nothing a automated system can detect OTHER than the person asking this person, even if a bit abrasively, why they made a stupid decision like that.

Usually what happens in these situations, is these kids go completely silent and just go about inting (can't deny, most of them have to be, no emotionally stable person reacts to criticism by going silent and inting).

I can't tell you how many chat restrictions i've gotten for simply being mad at a guy who ints for 15-20 minutes on purpose after a single question or mild criticism. And nothing has happened to them (I see them game after game after game, if I play at low pop times).

>There's a reason system of law are not actively democratic, vocal minorities would have you hung for things like pre-marrital sex, because more relaxed and laid back opinions, though maybe the majority, don't actively report and protest against those vocal minorities.
ie. Generally snowflakes report a lot more than your average gamer.

I feel like only this part was related to the OP or my response. You wanna talk about inting/trolling, then you can make your own discussion. 

Through the tribunal and other sources of player feedback, we have the rules that make up the Instant Feedback System we have today that punishes negative chat, among other things. Whether or not you agree with how the rules are drawn up is up to you, but you play Riot's game, it's their rules.
There is a problem with toxcity bans and you're the problem. Take your punishment and move on

I'm not complaining about my ban, i didnt at all. I said that the norm is to flame in this game.
It's unfortunate, but it's the reality of the shitty situation
call someone trash when they go 0-5 toplane before 5 mins=insta ban riot are noobs probably the reason elo hell exists in b4down votes

Poor priority on riots part in what's really causing negative impacts on the game. Their just lazy and cbf doing manual reviews and easiest way for them is to use a bot that can review chats and not game play and probably statistics. 

Tribunal was a good feature back upto season 4 before we had the transfer to oce.
